description: Updates information about a registered game server to help Amazon GameLift FleetIQ track game server availability. This operation is called by a game server process that is running on an instance in a game server group. Use this operation to update the following types of game server information. You can make all three types of updates in the same request: Once a game server is successfully updated, the relevant statuses and timestamps are updated. Amazon GameLift FleetIQ Guide.

parameters.name: GameServerGroupName
parameters.description: A unique identifier for the game server group where the game server is running.

parameters.name: GameServerId
parameters.description: A custom string that uniquely identifies the game server to update.

nested_items.name: GameServer
nested_items.description: Object that describes the newly updated game server.

nested_items.name: GameServerGroupName
nested_items.description: A unique identifier for the game server group where the game server is running.

nested_items.name: GameServerGroupArn
nested_items.description: The ARN identifier for the game server group where the game server is located.

nested_items.name: GameServerId
nested_items.description: A custom string that uniquely identifies the game server. Game server IDs are developer-defined and are unique across all game server groups in an Amazon Web Services account.

nested_items.name: InstanceId
nested_items.description: The unique identifier for the instance where the game server is running. This ID is available in the instance metadata. EC2 instance IDs use a 17-character format, for example: i-1234567890abcdef0.

nested_items.name: ConnectionInfo
nested_items.description: The port and IP address that must be used to establish a client connection to the game server.

nested_items.name: GameServerData
nested_items.description: A set of custom game server properties, formatted as a single string value. This data is passed to a game client or service when it requests information on game servers.

nested_items.name: ClaimStatus
nested_items.description: Indicates when an available game server has been reserved for gameplay but has not yet started hosting a game. Once it is claimed, the game server remains in CLAIMED status for a maximum of one minute. During this time, game clients connect to the game server to start the game and trigger the game server to update its utilization status. After one minute, the game server claim status reverts to null.

nested_items.name: UtilizationStatus
nested_items.description: Indicates whether the game server is currently available for new games or is busy. Possible statuses include:
AVAILABLE - The game server is available to be claimed. A game server that has been claimed remains in this status until it reports game hosting activity.
UTILIZED - The game server is currently hosting a game session with players.

nested_items.name: RegistrationTime
nested_items.description: Timestamp that indicates when the game server registered. The format is a number expressed in Unix time as milliseconds (for example "1469498468.057").

nested_items.name: LastClaimTime
nested_items.description: Timestamp that indicates the last time the game server was claimed. The format is a number expressed in Unix time as milliseconds (for example "1469498468.057"). This value is used to calculate when a claimed game server's status should revert to null.

nested_items.name: LastHealthCheckTime
nested_items.description: Timestamp that indicates the last time the game server was updated with health status. The format is a number expressed in Unix time as milliseconds (for example "1469498468.057"). After game server registration, this property is only changed when a game server update specifies a health check value.
